title: Shut Up & Write!® LONDON / PECKHAM
description:
Join us for an hour of writing! We’ve discovered that it’s strikingly helpful to write with other writers. See if it’s true for you at 18:00 on Wednesday afternoons/evenings.

Be it a book, blog, script, essay, dissertation, resume, melody, poem or just plain work stuff, you are invited to write it with us. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice. Instead of just thinking about writing, come and get some real writing done.

SCHEDULE:
18:00 - Quick introductions
18:15 - Timer starts: write for 1 hour
19:15 - The End: chat, take off, or keep writing

OPTIONAL SOCIALIZING happens at 19:30. Writing is very solitary. Connecting (and sometimes even commiserating) with other writers is a cool thing.

BEING LATE IS OKAY: just show up and get settled, then check-in with me after the session. (I’ll be the person with the Shut Up & Write! sign.) If you were on time, please be willing to make room for the friendly latecomer.

Happy writing and I look forward to seeing you at the Peckham Pelican!

What Should I Bring?
Whatever you need to be able to write!
Bring earbuds/earplugs if you want to block the cafe’s overhead music or the occasional conversation by other patrons.

Other Important Details:
To be as Covid safe as we can, we will try to sit outside when possible so make sure laptops are charged and perhaps bring a notebook.
Please thank our hosts by purchasing something.

Be it a book, blog, script, essay, dissertation, resume, melody, poem or just plain work stuff, you are invited to write it with us. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice. Instead of just thinking about writing, come and get some real writing done.

SCHEDULE:
18:00 - Quick introductions
18:15 - Timer starts: write for 1 hour
19:15 - The End: chat, take off, or keep writing

OPTIONAL SOCIALIZING happens at 19:30. Writing is very solitary. Connecting (and sometimes even commiserating) with other writers is a cool thing.

BEING LATE IS OKAY: just show up and get settled, then check-in with me after the session. (I’ll be the person with the Shut Up & Write! sign.) If you were on time, please be willing to make room for the friendly latecomer.

Happy writing and I look forward to seeing you at the Peckham Pelican!

What Should I Bring?
Whatever you need to be able to write!
Bring earbuds/earplugs if you want to block the cafe’s overhead music or the occasional conversation by other patrons.

Other Important Details:
To be as Covid safe as we can, we will try to sit outside when possible so make sure laptops are charged and perhaps bring a notebook.
Please thank our hosts by purchasing something.

title: CREATIVE WRITING with FREE snacks, a FREE book, and a drink in your hand!
description:
Hi there,

This is a MeetUp for writers and non-writers, alike.

It's a friendly writing workshop and social event.

Come in (at 6:30pm) and buy yourself a drink at the bar. Then make your way upstairs to the large meeting room (pictured) and say hello to some other friendly faces, before we start the workshop (at 7:00pm).

There will be FREE snacks - and a FREE Penguin book for each person to take home and keep.

During the session you will be guided through a number of different writing games and prompts. By the end, you'll have a whole host of new, exciting bits of writing to be proud of.

If you want to make new friends, this event is for you.

If you want to make forays into a new, serious piece of writing, this event is for you.

If you want to have a beer and surprise yourself doing something fun and spontaneous, this event is for you!

***THIS GROUP IS OPEN TO PEOPLE OF ALL LEVELS AND THERE WILL NEVER BE ANY PRESSURE TO READ YOUR WORK IN FRONT OF THE GROUP***

Any questions, please don't hesitate to text or WhatsApp on 07534 981 636.

Can't wait to see you soon.

Cheers!

Sean

title: Let us film you reading your work!
description:
If you have a poem, or a very short story, and you'd like some exposure reading your work for an online audience, please come along to this event.

We would like to film you reading your work and feature it on our Instagram and Facebook pages. A select few people will also be featured in our online journal.

Please send the organiser the poem, or the piece, that you'd like to read (recordings can be anything between 10 seconds and 3 minutes, so please make sure your reading fits into this parameter).

If you're somebody who'd like to raise a profile, this will be perfect for you - you'll always be able to link to this video. If you'd like to do this just for fun - to show your friends and family - that's also great. We'd love to have you there!

There will be a limited number of spaces, so please RSVP and confirm your interest with the organiser if you know for certain you'd like to attend. All poems and short fictions must be approved before the date of the filming.

As always, feel free to text us on 07534 981 636 if you have any questions and/or would like to be added to our WhatsApp community for updates.

Cheers!

title: A Write & a Pint: The 3 Week Course!  (ALL 3 WEEKS ARE INCLUDED IN THE PRICE)
description:
Hi there,

The aim of the 3 Week Course is to produce something more substantial than we’re able to put together in a one-off session.

For you, this might be the beginning of a novel, or a short piece of fiction, a memoir, a series of flash fictions, or maybe even a saga.

Come and meet us at the amazing Courthouse Hotel in Shoreditch at 6:30pm each Thursday. The sessions will begin at 7pm (no later), so this will give you plenty of time to find us and get yourself a drink at the bar.

In the first session there will be a FREE Penguin book for each person to take home and keep. In subsequent sessions, you’ll receive handouts, with guidance and pointers to help you improve your writing. In each session, we'll also provide some free snacks. This will help you enjoy your drink (and your writing) just that little bit more!

We’ll work together on character, perspective, tone, and dialogue, and instead of using a rigid plot structure, we’ll be using methods that encourage spontaneity.

By the end of the three weeks, you ought to have a fair amount written. We'll even invite you to publish all or part of it in our online journal (though, of course, you won't have to if you don't want to!).

.....

If you want to make new friends, this event is for you.

If you want to make forays into a new, serious piece of writing, this event is for you.

If you want to have a beer or a glass of wine (during/after each session) and surprise yourself doing something fun and spontaneous, this event is for you!

***THE GROUP IS FOR EVERYBODY FROM COMPLETE BEGINNERS TO SEASONED PROFESSIONALS. THERE WILL NEVER BE ANY PRESSURE TO READ YOUR WORK IN FRONT OF THE OTHER PEOPLE THERE***

Any questions, please don't hesitate to text or WhatsApp us on 07534 981 636.

title: Surrealism and Writing: The All Day Sesh!
description:
This is a special, SURREAL edition of the All Day Sesh!

Surrealism is the most dramatic and thrilling of the modernist cultural movements of the 20s and 30s. It is best known for its dream-like visual artworks, but it’s writings are also magnificent, marked by strange juxtapositions, tangential ramblings, partial or broken meanings and oblique allusions to political or emotional states.

To work in the surrealist mode is to dream big, to unearth the most exciting and hidden elements of the unconscious, to access hitherto latent parts of what feels like a foreign part of the psyché.

For this special edition of the All Day Sesh! will be looking at parts of the surrealist manifesto by Andre Breton, some poems by Paul Eluard, some surrealist prose fiction, and examples of surrealism in contemporary writing. You will also have the opportunity to try surrealist writing for yourself!

“Surrealism is destructive” said Salvador Dali, “but it destroys only what it considers to be shackles limiting our vision.”

Come and join us and experience the mesmerising power of surrealist writing, first hand. Produce your own surrealist work. Take a leap into the unknown. Emerge changed and fascinate!

***NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY. ALL WILL BE REVEALED***

This event includes:

1 x two-hour workshop (on SURREALISM IN LITERATURE)
1 x free book
1 x free breakfast
1 x free tea or coffee
3 x 40-minute writing sessions (with breaks in between)
1 x free early evening drink
1 x bunch of new writing buddies!

As always, this is a group for writers and non-writers, alike. No experience necessary. If you're already writing a novel - great! If you've never written anything in your life - that's also great!

...

Meet us at 10:45am at Finch's Pub in Old Street for a free breakfast.

When we've had our breakfast and we're sipping tea or coffee, we’ll have a 2 hour workshop on SURREALISM IN LITERATURE.

At 1:30pm, we’ll sit down and have 3 x 40-minute writing sessions, using the Pomodorro technique (this means you'll get a 15-minute break between each stint of writing, and a chance to relax and confer with others, or whatever it is you feel like doing).

*Note: there may be a tiny bit of background noise, but we’ll provide earplugs for you. Please bring your own headphones, if you’d prefer to use these.

To finish the day off, we'll go together for a FREE, early-evening drink in a bar (also very nearby).

You'll be more than welcome to have the one drink, or to sit and have another couple with the crew, for as long as people want to stay.

...

15 people, max.

You will never have to read your work in front of the group!

title: DEATH in literature + A FREE book and some FREE snacks! @Waterstones
description:
Welcome to this morbid-but-literary edition of A Write & a Pint!

We have been invited to host the session in the basement café/bar of Waterstones, Tottenham Court Road - so we'll be surrounded by books!

This will be a 2-hour creative writing session on the subject of "Death in Literature". We'll be looking at incredible passages from famous literary works and trying to emulate styles.

As always, there will be handouts, some free snacks and a free book, for you to take home and keep!

If you're a complete beginner, this event is for you.

If you're a seasoned prose writer, this event is for you.

If you're looking to do something spontaneous and fun, make friends and try something different, this event is for you!

You will never be pressured to read your work out in front of the group.

We assure you, you'll go away buzzing with ideas and full of warmth and happiness (in spite of the deathly theme, itself!)

Feel free to invite your friends to sign up, too. The more the merrier.

*No experience necessary.

Text or WhatsApp on 07534 981 636 if you have any questions, and/or would like to be added to our WhatsApp group for updates about future events.

Join us on instagram (search: "writeandpint"), or book directly with our website: www.writeandpint.com (you can also subscribe on our website for email updates if that's easier for you).

title: Poetry Writing for Beginners: the All Day Sesh!
description:
This is an all day event for people who want to learn to write poetry!

As always, it is a group for writers and non-writers, alike. Beginners and professionals. Whoever you are. No experience necessary.

A Saturday full of food and drink and fun, exciting writing exercises.

A FREE Breakfast, a FREE book… and plenty of time for writing.

...

Meet us at 10:45am at Finch's Pub in Old Street/Moorgate, for breakfast.

When we've had our breakfast and we're sipping tea or coffee, we’ll have a 2 hour workshop on poetry (rhythm, rhyme, stanza formation, metaphor, line-breaks, etc.).

At 1:30pm, we’ll walk together to a very nearby café where we'll sit down and have 3 x 40-minute writing sessions, using the Pomodorro technique (this means you'll get a break between each stint of writing, and a chance to relax and confer with others, or whatever it is you feel like doing). You can use these writing sessions to work on your own thing, in your own time.

At the end of the day, we'll invite you to stay for a drink with the crew, to celebrate (though this is not compulsory).

You'll be more than welcome to just have the one drink, or to sit and have another couple with the crew, for as long as people want to stay.

...

Included in this event is:

1 x two-hour workshop
1 x free book
1 x free breakfast
3 x 40-minute writing sessions (with 15-minute breaks in between)
1 x bunch of new writing buddies!

This is a full day event (11am — 6pm, approx.)

You will never have to read your work in front of the group!

***PLEASE NOTE: there is officially a no refund policy for this event. However, if you cancel a number of days in advance and we're able to refill your space, we will indeed refund you. Similarly, moving a cancelled RSVP over to a future event is contingent upon being able to refill the space that you vacate.

title: One-to-one writing consultation (*let's arrange a time!)
description:
[RSVP here to show an interest! See our contact details at the bottom to arrange a meet]

We're usually busy hosting workshops, Q&A's, social events, and one-to-one sessions. But we're still looking to work with more people!

If you're somebody who is (or would like to be) working on a novel, a short story, or some poems, we might be able to help you.

A Write & a Pint offers one-to-one sessions in creative writing and editorial feedback:

We charge £40 for a 2-hour session (*note: this is if you would like to be guided through creative writing exercises and receive feedback, one-to-one + handouts, excerpts, advice, and a free book).

We charge £80 for a detailed analysis of up to 8,000 words + a 2-hour session to talk it all over (*note: this is if you're already writing something and would like advice and coaching as to where you can make improvements and take new directions in your work).

title: Breakfast + Workshop + ***MEET THE AUTHOR / Q&A***
description:
[***NOW OPEN FOR BOOKING. The event will cost £29.99 per person (we usually charge less than this, but since the event includes a £12.99 hardback book, we have needed to increase the cost on this occasion).]

......................

This is a very special event, featuring the widely celebrated debut novelist, Gareth Rubin.

Rubin's work is published by Penguin and belongs to the historical fiction genre. It is also an excellent example of the page-turning thriller.

......................

The day itself will include:

- a breakfast
- a tea or coffee
- a 2-hour workshop on story and setting
- a hardback copy of Rubin's book, Liberation Square, which he will be happy to sign and/or dedicate for you!
- a 1-hour lunch break
- a casual, friendly Q&A with the author himself
- an hour of reflective, personal writing, to consolidate what you've learned, and where you'd like to take your work from here
- the opportunity to stay behind for an early evening drink!

......................

We will meet at 10:45am, have breakfast together, followed by a 2-hour workshop on Rubin's writing, alongside some other examples of historical fiction, then a lunch break, before the author will join us for a friendly Q&A session. Once this is done, we will have an hour of quiet, reflective writing, so that you'll be able to get your ideas together and make any notes you'd like to make, on everything you've learned.

If you'd like to hear about the mechanics of a published author's approach to writing, this event is for you.

If you'd like to hear about a published author's experience of getting published, this event is for you.

If you'd like a signed, hardback copy of a bestselling, brilliantly reviewed historical fiction thriller, this event is for you.

***NO EXPERIENCE OF WRITING IS NECESSARY FOR THIS EVENT***
***BEGINNERS ARE ABSOLUTELY WELCOME***

We hope to see lots of your there!

[*There are no refunds for this event].

title: Creative Writing / Slang & Dialect + a FREE book + some FREE snacks + handouts
description:
***2-Hour Creative Writing Workshop on Slang and Dialect***

Hi there,

If you’re free next Thursday evening (11th July), whoever you are, please feel free to RSVP and join us for our 2-hour creative writing workshop + free book + some free snacks.

…………………………………………………………………………………………………………………

Slang and dialect are how we all speak from time to time… with our friends, our families, at home, in the city.

So, why don’t we write this way, too?

From Trainspotting to Finnegans Wake, some of the greatest stories are written in slang or local dialects.

From patois to pigeon English, from Cockney to Scouse to Geordie, our world is alive with the sound of local community.

If you’re struggling to find your voice as a creative writer, join us next Thursday, 11th July, from 6:45–9pm, for this special, informal edition of A Write & a Pint.

No experience is necessary.

We’ll be showing you some excellent examples of slang and dialect in existing literature. Then we’ll be using some playful writing prompts to get you writing in your own style.

For one night, forget the Queen’s grammar, forget Oxford syntax… be free to ramble away in the unique cadence of your own voice.

You will never be pressured to read your work aloud to the group, and you are not expected to have any knowledge of any particular dialect or slang.

As William Faulkner once said: “Write what you know”.

Indeed: write what you know in the only voice you’ve ever known it: your own.

If you’d like to come to this workshop, you’ll receive:

1 x free book
1 x 2-hour workshop on slang and dialect in creative writing
1 x free snacks
1 x handout

+ the invitation to stick around for an evening drink afterwards, to celebrate everything you’ve achieved.

As always please text or WhatsApp us on 07534 981 636 if you have any questions about this event (or any other), or if you would like to be added to our WhatsApp community for updates.

Don’t be shy—we’d love to hear from you!

Cheers.

Sean :)

title: Novel Beginnings - How to Start Your Story(?) + a FREE book and some FREE snacks
description:
Hi there,

In this edition of A Write & a Pint, we're going to be looking at how other authors begin their stories - what aspects and criteria there are for a compelling first page.

Then we're going to have a go at writing our own!

If you'd like to join us, just RSVP here, then come to The George Inn, in London Bridge, and buy yourself a drink at the bar, then make your way upstairs and meet some new friendly faces in the Talbot Room, at 6:45pm, to start the workshop at 7pm.

There will be a free book and some free snacks for everybody, to sustain us through our writing.

***NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY***

***NO PRESSURE TO READ YOUR WORK OUT IN FRONT OF OTHER PEOPLE... EVER***

***SUITABLE FOR ABSOLUTE BEGINNERS, AS WELL AS SEASONED PROS***

title: Dating & Creative Writing (+ a Q&A with Luke Tredget + a Signed Copy)
description:
Hi there,

This is a creative writing event for writers and non-writers, alike. It is for anybody interested in developing their style, of any level - beginners are absolutely, 100% more than welcome.

Included in the event is:

1 x free breakfast
1 x 2-hour creative writing workshop on dating and creative writing (don't worry if you're not dating *right now* - you can draw on previous experience)
1 x ***free, signed copy of Luke Tredget's novel Kismet***
1 x lunch break
1 x friendly Q&A session with Luke (about his novel, about style, about getting published, about dating apps, about... anything else we can think of to ask him on the day)
1 x 40 minute private writing session, to put into practice everything you've learned
+ the opportunity to stick around for an evening drink to celebrate!

As always, there is ***NEVER ANY PRESSURE TO READ YOUR WORK ALOUD IN FRONT OF THE GROUP... EVER***.

Attendees will arrive at 10:45am, to begin at 11am. Here, we will take your breakfast + tea or coffee order. Then after breakfast, we will guide you through a series of playful creative writing exercises, so that you can begin to formulate your own ideas, in your own unique style.

After breakfast and our 2-hour writing workshop, we will have a lunch break. After this, author Luke Tredget will arrive and we will reconvene for a friendly Q&A with him (*Note: don't worry. You won't be expected to ask questions or have anything to say. If nobody has any questions, you can just listen to Luke and your workshop host, Sean, in conversation about Luke's novel, Kismet, and about everything to do with publication, from writing approaches and style to finding an agent, sending off a manuscript and seeing your name in print).

Luke has agreed that he will sign a free copy of his book for you, to take away and keep!

If you have any questions about this event (or any other), please don't hesitate to text or WhatsApp us on 07534 981 636 - we'd love to hear from you.

We hope to see you there for this incredible opportunity.

Until then...

Cheers! :)

...........................................

Praise for Luke's novel:

"Sharp, witty and full of tension...an intelligent and highly readable novel."―Irish Times

"Tredget's trenchant, entertaining debut traces how big data and social media have become an obstacle for healthy relationships...An incisive view of the uncertainties of contemporary adulthood."―Publishers Weekly

"Kismet is compelling for more than its unflinching study of the infiltration of romance by technology and algorithms. At its heart this novel is about what endures in spite of all that; a modern love story of exceptional warmth, intelligence and humanity."―Luke Kennard, author of The Transition

"Tredget writes a funny, timely story, with flawed and relatable characters, about how technology affects our desires and what it means to 'settle.' Though he satirizes modern dating and the idea of perfection in a relationship, he writes with an engaging warmth and lightness. Readers will surely enjoy this witty modern love story."―Booklist

title: FREE Social Event for Writers and Readers of London!
description:
If you're a writer, a reader, a beginner or professional... please RSVP now and come along to A Write & a Pint's ***FREE Social Event***.

No workshop.

No experience necessary.

No big introductions.

Just you, us, people... drinking, chatting, sharing ideas and getting to know one another.

If you've been to one of our social events before you'll know how fun they can be, and how useful and inspirational it can be to meet other people who are also interested in reading or writing.

We regularly have attendees who are working in fields as diverse as journalism, fashion, marketing... people who are novelists, playwrights, screenwriters, poets... but also (and perhaps mainly) people who are only just starting out, attempting to write their first short story, or something similar.

Whoever you are, we promise you there will be no pressure and you'll be more than welcome. We can't wait to meet you.

If you have any questions at all, please don't hesitate to text or WhatsApp us on 07534 981 636. We're happy to help!

Hope to see you there!

Cheers :)

title: Creative Writing & Eating & Drinking + a FREE book!
description:
Hi there,

This is a MeetUp for writers and non-writers, alike.

It is a friendly writing workshop and social event.

Come in at 6:45pm; buy yourself a drink at the bar, then come and find us in the Talbot Room, and say hello to some other friendly faces, before we start the workshop at 7:00pm.

There will be FREE snacks - and a FREE Penguin book for each person to take home and keep.

The theme of this workshop will be RANDOMNESS and SPONTANEITY (if you've come to one of these workshops before, don't worry, they'll be new exercises, and if you haven't come before, don't worry, it is all suitable for absolute beginners)!

During the session you will be guided through a number of different writing games and prompts. By the end, you'll have a whole host of new, exciting bits of writing to be proud of.

If you want to make new friends, this event is for you.

If you want to make forays into a new, serious piece of writing, this event is for you.

If you want to have a beer and surprise yourself doing something fun and spontaneous, this event is for you!

***THIS GROUP IS OPEN TO PEOPLE OF ALL LEVELS AND THERE WILL NEVER BE ANY PRESSURE TO READ YOUR WORK IN FRONT OF THE GROUP***

Any questions, please don't hesitate to text or WhatsApp on 07534 981 636.

Can't wait to see you soon.

Cheers!

Sean

***PLEASE NOTE: there is officially a no refund policy for this event. However, if you cancel a number of days in advance and we're able to refill your space, we will indeed refund you. Similarly, moving a cancelled RSVP over to a future event is contingent upon being able to refill the space that you vacate.

title: Life Writing: from Autobiography to Fiction (+ a FREE book & some FREE snacks!)
description:
Hi there,

This is a MeetUp for writers and non-writers, alike.

It's a friendly writing workshop and social event.

Come in at 6:45pm; buy yourself a drink at the bar, have a seat. Then say hello to some other friendly faces, before we start the workshop at 7:00pm.

There will be FREE snacks - and a FREE Penguin book for each person to take home and keep.

During the session you will be guided through a number of different writing games and prompts, but we'll be focusing specifically on Life Writing: from Autobiography to Fiction. This is ideal for anyone struggling to produce ideas for fictional stories, but also incredibly useful for adding detail and depth to any existing fictional characters you might be creating. It is also perfectly suitable for people who haven't yet started writing anything at all! There will be handouts, as well to keep you inspired. By the end, you'll have a whole host of new, exciting bits of writing to be proud of.

If you want to make new friends, this event is for you.

If you want to make forays into a new, serious piece of writing, this event is for you.

If you want to have a beer and surprise yourself doing something fun and spontaneous, this event is for you!

title: Day of Poetry + Breakfast, tea/coffee, a free book & LOADS of writing!
description:
This is an all day event for people who want to learn to write poetry!

As always, it is a group for writers and non-writers, alike. Beginners and professionals. Whoever you are. No experience necessary.

A Saturday full of food and drink and fun, exciting writing exercises.

A Breakfast, a tea or coffee, a free book… and plenty of time for writing.

...

Meet us at 10:45am at Finch's Pub in Old Street/Moorgate, for breakfast.

When we've had our breakfast and we're sipping tea or coffee, we’ll have a 2 hour workshop on poetry (rhythm, rhyme, stanza formation, metaphor, line-breaks, etc.).

At 1:30pm, we’ll walk together to a very nearby café where we'll sit down and have 3 x 40-minute writing sessions, using the Pomodorro technique (this means you'll get a break between each stint of writing, and a chance to relax and confer with others, or whatever it is you feel like doing). You can use these writing sessions to work on your own thing, in your own time.

At the end of the day, we'll invite you to stay for a drink with the crew, to celebrate (though this is not compulsory).

You'll be more than welcome to just have the one drink, or to sit and have another couple with the crew, for as long as people want to stay.

...

Included in this event is:

1 x two-hour workshop
1 x free book
1 x free breakfast
3 x 40-minute writing sessions (with 15-minute breaks in between)
1 x bunch of new writing buddies!

This is a full day event (11am — 6pm, approx.)

You will never have to read your work in front of the group!

***PLEASE NOTE: there is officially a no refund policy for this event. However, if you cancel a number of days in advance and we're able to refill your space, we will indeed refund you. Similarly, moving a cancelled RSVP over to a future event is contingent upon being able to refill the space that you vacate.

title: Novel Beginnings - How to Start Your Story + food, drink, and a FREE book!
description:
# Novel Beginnings - How to Start Your Story + food, drink, and a FREE book!

[BOOK YOUR SPOT AT www.writeandpint.com/workshops]
...

***"It’s such a confidence trick, writing a novel. The main person you have to trick into confidence is yourself. This is hard to do alone". – Zadie Smith***

...
Let's get together and learn how to write the perfect beginning.

Whether you've already written your novel/short story or you're starting something afresh, this is the perfect workshop to hone your style, tone, tempo, and general approach.

We'll be looking at everybody from Zadie Smith to John Cheever, Francois Sagan to Katherine Mansfield, Chimamanda Ngoze Adichie to Jorge Luis Borges.

We'll be looking at what agents and publishers might want from the opening chapter.

We'll be setting you up with some fun, exciting writing exercises, to make sure you get the chance to finesse your approach and leave with something new and brilliant, ready to take home and edit.

First of all though, we'll be ordering teas, coffees and brunch, before we settle in for a warm-up exercise, to get our imaginations flowing.

No experience of writing is necessary for this workshop.

No pressure to read or share your work with the group.

Just sit back, listen, learn, read, write, eat, drink, and come away full of new knowledge and expertise in the art of writing.

***"The scariest moment is always just before you start". – Stephen King***

So please feel free to text us on 07534 981 636 if you have any questions at all - we'll be more happy to help :)

title: Saturday 15th January 2022 3.00pm  Classical Chamber Music Hangout Meetup
description:
1. Classical Music & Chamber Music Meet-up: A few of us hangout to play woodwind, brass instruments, harp, classical guitar and strings, accordion. We do not have room for pianos (sorry!)

If you know your way around your classical instrument (cello, violin, flute, clarinet etc), and are interested in meeting like minded instrumentalists to grow and nurture classical ensemble playing- drop us a message with your instrument and repertoire interest!

We play in an independent acoustic atelier cafe space in the London Borough of Lewisham with public transport links. Open to all ages, gender, race and diversity. Under 18s require parental permission and independent transport arrangements.

Players share repertoire before meetup and we work out what to play together following different voice parts and/or arrangements. We are a respectful group and ask the same of participants.

[Max. = 8 instrumental players]

group.name: THE FILM ATELIER  Folk Indie Classical Music Jam, Gigs Meets

title: London Southeast Singer-Songwriters Session Musicians Meet Up
description:
Who Should Join: - gigging acoustic instrumentalists, singer-songwriters, session indie, folk, acoustic players, keen musicians who know their way around their instrument and looking to join in other singers' songs, develop improvisation skills.

What we are not: - we are not an Open Mic. Funk, R'nB', electronica, hip hop and commercial music isn't what we do.

What we do at events: - We are a new independent start-up! We take each others' songs and songwriting and flesh them out from your bedroom solo acoustic pandemic playing to develop a wider session sound. We are a small independent local community of budding musicians who met and performed on the gig circuit and extend a welcome to budding musicians and acoustic singer-songwriters to develop as a community.

How long? - Usually 2 hours long acoustic music sessions limited to a max of 8 musicians. We work on shared and agreed music repertoire and play as an ensemble or session. Longer sessions break into improvisational jam sessions!

Where? We have our own private venue in the London borough of Lewisham with reasonable transport links. Those interested - get in touch. This is not a drop-in session.

group.name: THE FILM ATELIER  Folk Indie Classical Music Jam, Gigs Meets

title: Sunday 23th January 2022 2.00pm London Chinese Chamber Music Ensemble Meet Up!
description:
4. London Chinese Music Ensemble Meet up:

Do you play a chinese instrument like an erhu, guzheng,pipa, liuqin, bawu, dizi or suona?

This is a meet up for our friends in London who play a chinese musical instrument and are familiar with classical chinese folk repertoire: some knowledge of the chinese written music system is required.

The music ensemble regularly meet and perform in concert and follow the annual festivals and its associated music. If you aren't sure of your standard, drop a note. We have some links to chinese music instrument tutors in London.

Bring your instrument and play. Venue in the London Borough of Lewisham - RSVP only. We have our own house guzheng and other less portable instruments.

group.name: THE FILM ATELIER  Folk Indie Classical Music Jam, Gigs Meets

title: London Southeast [Lewisham] Acoustic Session Musicians Meet Up
description:
Who Should Join: - gigging acoustic instrumentalists, singer-songwriters, session indie, folk, acoustic players, keen musicians who know their way around their instrument and looking to join in other singers' songs, develop improvisation skills and play each others' songs in a band style!

Instruments: Vocalists, guitarists (limits on how many per session); mandolin, flute, cajon, bass (electric), cello, fiddles, bodhran, harp join in the mix.

What we are not: - we are not an Open Mic. Funk, R'nB', electronica, hip hop and commercial music isn't what we do.

What we do at events: - We are a new independent start-up! We take each others' songs and songwriting and flesh them out from your solo acoustic pandemic bedroom playing to develop a wider session sound. We are a small independent local community of budding musicians who met and performed on the gig circuit and extend a welcome to budding musicians and acoustic singer-songwriters to develop as a community. You should be performance ready standard, seasoned or new - we are welcoming and respectful of one another and ask the same of newcomers.

How long? - 2 hours or longer! Acoustic music sessions limited to a max of 8 musicians. Longer sessions break into improvisational jam sessions!

Where? We have our own private venue in the London borough of Lewisham with reasonable transport links. Those interested - get in touch for details.

We've started a Wednesday evening acoustic alt. folk meet up in Lewisham [London Southeast] at our venue space, The Film Atelier in southeast London.

Style is mostly acoustic, singer-songwriter and Americana country like Gregory Alan Isakov whom we aspire to (and fail miserably) and other alternative folk genres. We say alt. folk, which includes traditional folk in contemporary arrangements but not folk music played rigidly.

This is a session for all attending to join in. We have a mix of experience, from performing, to open mics and those starting out playing ensemble. We have house amps, mics and full drum kit, steel string guitars, mandolin family, cello and folk instruments.

PM for details. Session will be open for a small listening audience in the near future.

title: THE FILM ATELIER presents an evening of live acoustic music [OPENING WEEK]
description:
This is our intimate opening week!

We're not like other venues: everything we do is hand-crafted from making coffee, specialising in method coffee; tea; film photography and acoustic music! We do not serve alcohol: under 18s welcome (parental consent).

Come on over for a casual listen at this opening week's acoustic music night is led by **FRANKIE D**, singer-songwriter of intelligent lyrics and amicable alternative folk acoustic followed by musicians **WATCH PAINT DRY** and **GOOD TIMING**

**VENUE: THE FILM ATELIER, 314 Sangley Road LONDON SE6 2JT**
**Nearest Trains:** CATFORD BRIDGE/CATFORD

**Car:** ULEZ Free: stay south of the A205 South Circular Road - free parking in residential streets

**Buses:** Numbers 181/284 from LEWISHAM DLR/BR Station to STOP X directly opposite THE FILM ATELIER

**Music:** Acoustic Music Evening by **Frankie D, Watch Paint Dry, Good Timing**

**Contact:** thefilmatelierse6@gmail.com

group.name: THE FILM ATELIER  Folk Indie Classical Music Jam, Gigs Meets

title: London Southeast [Lewisham] Classical Musicians Meet-Up
description:
Classical Music & Chamber Music Meet-up: London Southeast [London Borough of Lewisham]

We're a friendly group of local classical musicians who meet to jam informally. If you like classical music and know your way around a classical instrument and want to meet up to play with others, come alone! We share some music spanning medieval, renaissance, modern and contemporary - all players welcome to recommend their own repertoire.

Recorders, brass, woodwind, classical guitar, string instruments welcome. We don't have a piano sorry (!)

[Max. = 8 instrumental players] All ages welcome. Under 18s require parental consent and independent/own travel arrangements.

\*\* sorry for late notice \*\*

group.name: THE FILM ATELIER  Folk Indie Classical Music Jam, Gigs Meets

title: BOARD GAMES EVENING @ THE FILM ATELIER!
description:
## Details

Taking a break from music ... we're hosting a Board Games Night this Tuesday 26th July from 5pm onwards!

Some of our regular CAT Cafe @ THE FILM ATELIER 314 Sangley Road LONDON SE6 2JT customers are into Dungeons & Dragons and other board games.

Now inviting applicants for Dungeons & Dragons and .. a Dungeon Master!

The way this works: we check on the sign-up how many are committed to playing: once we have a core minimum number of interested players committed to coming, we set the date on a weekday evening or move the date forward until we get the right numbers!

1\. Dungeons & Dragons
2\. Chess
3\. GO\!
4\. Scrabble
5\. Connect 4

Bring your own games boards - we have space indoors and outdoors in the relaxing surprise garden!

This meet-up is also combined with our languages meet-up so French, Spanish, English, Chinese speakers can practice over board games and botanical tea or organic iced coffee!

Let us know if you have any others!

group.name: THE FILM ATELIER  Folk Indie Classical Music Jam, Gigs Meets

title: Acoustic alt.folk jam session Meetup [London Southeast Lewisham]
description:
Acoustic Alt.folk Meetup [London Southeast]

Wednesday evening acoustic alt. folk meet up in THE FILM ATELIER, 314 Sangley Road, LONDON SE6 2JT [nearest station Catford/Catford Bridge; Buses 181/284 from Lewisham station stop X directly adjacent)

Style is mostly acoustic, singer-songwriter and Americana country with neo-trad interpretations and original music. We say alt. folk, which includes traditional folk in contemporary arrangements or even popular music played folk, but not folk music played rigidly.

This is a session for all attending to join in. We have a mix of experience, from performing solo musicians open to working beyond their own solo path, those developing confidence to perform folk and acoustic music to those getting into ensemble, session and band experience to grow their improvisation and aural playing. Everyone joins in, singer, background vocals, even tambourine, percussion. We have a few house instruments - check if you can't bring one over. We have house amps, mics and full drum kit, steel string guitars, mandolin family, cello and folk instruments. Local cafe audience present for feedback.

Sign up RSVP for musicians.

group.name: THE FILM ATELIER  Folk Indie Classical Music Jam, Gigs Meets

title: Falling Moon @ THE FILM ATELIER: Acoustic Folk Coffeehouse Concert
description:
Falling Moon Productions brings another coffeehouse concert to THE FILM ATELIER 314 Sangley Road LONDON SE6 2JT on Thursday 28th JULY @7pm onwards!

A wonderful lineup consisting of three evening acoustic folk acts \~ ***Hiding Places, Porch Culture &*** ***Frankie D*** celebrating new up and coming music in London's southeast's acoustic coffeehouse scene.

======================================================================

**THE FILM ATELIER 314 Sangley Road LONDON SE6 2JT** is unusual as London's only dedicated acoustic coffeehouse lounge venue serving high altitude organic (that's low caffeine) ice cold Peruvian indigenous coffee and fresh Peruvian pomegranate cold hand-pressed juice as well as our range of herbal tisane teas and fluffy Japanese Dorayaki dessert pancake filled with green matcha, mascarpone, chocolate ganache and select red bean.

By day, it is both a speciaist cafe and teahouse; a psychotherapy & counselling speciality therapy space for engaging with mental health challenges using Cognitive Analytic Therapy [CAT] and accredited clinical evidence based practices and a traditional film camera darkroom photography specialist studio, darkroom and chill out space for creatives eschewing digital interference in everyday life.

We're encouraging under 18s; families; well-behaved pets to attend and enjoy acoustic folk evenings of music like we used to! Tonight, three acoustic folk artists perform followed by a late evening social in our therapy garden yard sanctuary or intimate studio.

FREE ENTRY ON RSVP via Meet-up or email.

group.name: THE FILM ATELIER  Folk Indie Classical Music Jam, Gigs Meets

title: Acoustic alt.folk jam session Meetup [THE FILM ATELIER LONDON SE6 2JT]
description:
Acoustic Alt.folk Meetup [London Southeast]

We've started a Wednesday evening acoustic alt. folk meet up in Lewisham [London Southeast] at our venue space, THE FILM ATELIER, 314 Sangley Road, LONDON, SE6 2JT in southeast London at the start of the year and have been holding public jam sessions in our acoustic coffeehouse venue.

Style is mostly acoustic, singer-songwriter and Americana country like Gregory Alan Isakov whom we aspire to (and fail miserably) and other alternative folk genres. We say alt. folk, which includes traditional folk in contemporary arrangements or even popular music played folk, but not folk music played rigidly

We have a mix of experience, from solo performing, band performance to open mics and those starting out playing ensemble. Everyone joins in, singer, background vocals, even tambourine, percussion. We have a few house instruments - check if you can't bring one over. We have house amps, mics and full drum kit, steel string guitars, mandolin family, cello and folk instruments.

We play in the acoustic lounge of The Film Atelier behind the CAT Cafe where audience members sit and listen.

RSVP to sign up for session.

We've started a Wednesday evening acoustic alt. folk meet up in Lewisham [London Southeast] at our venue space, THE FILM ATELIER, 314 Sangley Road, LONDON, SE6 2JT in southeast London at the start of the year and have been holding public jam sessions in our acoustic coffeehouse venue.

Style is mostly acoustic, singer-songwriter and Americana country like Gregory Alan Isakov whom we aspire to (and fail miserably) and other alternative folk genres. We say alt. folk, which includes traditional folk in contemporary arrangements or even popular music played folk, but not folk music played rigidly

We have a mix of experience, from solo performing, band performance to open mics and those starting out playing ensemble. Everyone joins in, singer, background vocals, even tambourine, percussion. We have a few house instruments - check if you can't bring one over. We have house amps, mics and full drum kit, steel string guitars, mandolin family, cello and folk instruments.

We play in the acoustic lounge of The Film Atelier behind the CAT Cafe where audience members sit and listen.

RSVP to sign up for session.

title: A focused weekly club for writers to engage in "deep work"
description:
Our weekly Write Club 'Deep Work' is ideal for anyone who writes and needs a block of time to write and gain the inspiration from being around other writers.

The group meets every Thursday at @Work Hubs, a coworking community right by Euston Station.

This is how we roll:
9.30 - brief introduction and sharing with group your planned writing
9.45 - 11.15 - focused period of 'deep work' on your planned writing.
11.15 - group review of people's progress.

- Tea, coffee, water and super fast internet provided
- Healthy snacks
- No charge
- Bring your own laptop or typewriter

title: Art of Innovation Election Night Special
description:
The Art of Innovation: Election Night Special

https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/a/7/d/8/600_461322968.jpeg

Cast your vote early, and while the rest of the nation decides the colour and shape of the next government, join us to think differently about your work, and play with colours and shapes of all kinds. Book now to attend this lightly facilitated, free event. Enjoy a great view, lovely company and good conversation, while exploring some interesting, different, and creative ways to think about work.

This informal session is being held at the wonderful London offices of BDG, overlooking the River Thames.

BDG are very kindly providing some drinks and nibbles for your enjoyment. Spaces are limited, and though this event is free to attend, you need to Book to avoid disappointment.

In addition, you are welcome to join us for a deeper exploration of how to be more innovative and resilient at work. We have a London event running during the day on June 8th, (https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/the-art-of-innovation-tickets-33271171971) and one two day event in Berlin on July 4th and 5th. Click the links for more information and to book tickets.

Your hosts for the evening are:

Stephanie Barnes

Stephanie is a painter and knowledge management consultant. She works with organisations to make better use of what they know, utilising her strategic business knowledge, critical thinking, and creativity in the process.

Phil Dodson

Coach, Mentor, Blogger, Artist, Podcaster, Coworking Space Operator, Facilitator and speaker.
It’s all about why we do what we do, not what we do. Life is all about stories and being able to tell our own story. I am in love with writing, art and other communication and how it helps collaboration, connection, ideas, self-confidence and productivity.

Doug Shaw

Artist, Organisational Development Consultant, Facilitator.
I’m at my best when helping people find greater effectiveness, enjoyment and inquiry in their work. I believe together beats apart, productive beats busy, connection gives us meaning, and conversations are the bond. Curiosity is underrated. We are all artists.

title: Write Club E17 (Wednesday)
description:
**Welcome to Creator Write Club!**
We've been meeting in London coworking spaces for over seven years.

**What is Creator Write Club?**
Write Club is where you can write anything from a book chapter to a work email to a song or comedy script.

**Who comes to Write Club?**
Every week authors, freelancers, artists, academics, comedians, gamers, marketers, bloggers, developers, podcasters, event managers, musicians, rappers, poets, lawyers, and sailors gather with one goal: - to work on their writing for two hours.

**How does Write Club work?**
Come and be ready to share what you intend to work on in the session.

**Start writing from 10:00 am sharp!**

We'll all write for around two hours and check in again at the end, so share our progress.

**That sounds scary?!**
We make extra effort to make sure everyone feels welcome and can do their work.

You only need to share what you are comfortable with sharing.
This group has always been relaxed, open and supportive.

**Food and Drink?**
There is an open kitchen with all-day breakfast, coffee, tea and biscuits, and fruit and water.

**Doors open from 9:30 am, and the main writing session is 10 am - 12 pm at [Creative Works](https://www.creativeworks.space/) - [Blackhorse Lane, Walthamstow E17 6DS](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Creative+Works/@51.5886642,-0.0420934,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x48761dd1e1d2ff2d:0x3298c94ad8dc5a6c!8m2!3d51.5886642!4d-0.0399047)**

That's only a minute's walk from Blackhorse Road Underground & Rail Station.

13 minutes to King's Cross on the Victoria Line and 17 minutes to Oxford Circus.

**\*Space is limited - we only have ten chairs around the table!**

title: Write Club Brixton (Friday)
description:
**Welcome to Write Club!**
We've been meeting in London coworking spaces for over seven years.

**What is Write Club?**
Write Club is where you can write anything from a book chapter to a work email.

**Who comes to Write Club?**
Every week authors, freelancers, academics, comedians, marketers, bloggers, developers, event managers, musicians, poets, lawyers and sailors gather around a table with one goal - to work on their writing for two hours.

**Join us from 12 pm to 2 pm.**

Our host for the Friday Group is [Impact Brixton](https://impactbrixton.com/), the vibrant local coworking space above Brixton Market.

[Impact Brixton](https://impactbrixton.com/) is less than a two-minute walk from Brixton tube station, in zone 2 on the Victoria line.

**How does Write Club work?**
Come and be ready to share what you intend to work on in the session.
Start writing from noon sharp.

We'll all write for around two hours and check in again at the end, so share our progress.

**That sounds scary?!**
We make extra effort to ensure everyone feels welcome and can do their work.

You only need to share what you are comfortable with sharing.
This group has always been relaxed, open and supportive.

**Food and Drink?**
There is tea, filter coffee, wifi and water here, and feel free to bring some cakes, fruit or brain food to share!

[Impact Brixton](https://impactbrixton.com/) is above Brixton Market, so you can check the many excellent independent coffee shops and restaurants here - [Brixton Market.](https://brixtonvillage.com/eat)

**p.s. Every Friday, [Impact Brixton](https://impactbrixton.com/) also hosts the [Creator Club Happy Hour](https://impactbrixton.com/events/).**

If you are a writer, videographer, entrepreneur, blogger, speaker, freelancer or doing anything else that enables you to monetise your creativity, we'd love to see you!

Enjoy a complimentary rum punch and happy hour cocktails in our iconic black bar between 6 pm and 8 pm.

Join other folks every Friday to connect with other creators and find collaboration partners.

Do you have a business or want to become a creator?

Maybe your just starting up and want to meet more creators?

If the answer is yes, you should come and join us every Friday!

**RSVP here >> for the [Creator Club Happy Hour](https://impactbrixton.com/events/).**

title: Creator Club Open Mic Night & Happy Hour (Online & In Person)
description:
**On Fridays, authors, freelancers, artists, academics, comedians, gamers, marketers, bloggers, developers, podcasters, event managers, musicians, rappers, poets, lawyers, and sailors gather at Creator Club open mic with one goal:**

✅ To network and meet potential collaborators and supporters.

**The Meet Up is ONLINE and is a live stream via Instagram.**

**🎥 [Watch this clip on Instagram from previous Creator Clubs.](https://www.instagram.com/reel/CgO8gg3oomj/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link)🎥**

When you RSVP, we'll send you a link to book to come in person at [Impact Brixton](https://impactbrixton.com), a friendly local coworking space by Brixton Tube.

# Agenda

Open mic starts at **7.30 pm** \- this will be live streamed for you folks here on Meet Up\.

(See below for in-person details)

**As a creator in the room, you can get on the mic:**
You'll have 5mins to talk about what you are working on, what inspired you to start, and the most significant challenge you have or are currently facing.

These five minutes are also for practising public speaking while creating engaging content.

It is a great place to ask for what help you need, which creators you'd like to connect with or anything else!

# How Creator Club helped us:

Through this Creator Club community, we decided how to move forward with these meet-ups.

A painful but collaborative lesson, now we see a clear and better future for what we are doing with this meet-up community.

At IB Creator Club, we welcome all dreamers to come to hang out, meet, learn and watch the magic happen.

(See below for more details on this)

**🎥 [Watch this clip on Instagram from previous Creator Clubs.](https://www.instagram.com/reel/CgO8gg3oomj/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link) 🎥**

# How do I come in person?

When you RSVP for the **live stream on Instagram**, we'll send a link to book the in-person event.

Right now, 'network events' can only be online on Meetup.com, and there is limited space in the room.

# The timings for the in-person are:

**18:00** doors open, and happy hour on 2-4-1 cocktails.

**19:00** get ready for the open mic live stream

**19:30 Open mic** live stream on Instagram

**20:30** wrap up

**21:00** event overhead out to party!

# The future of our Meet Ups

We've been running [London Bloggers Meet Up](https://www.meetup.com/londonbloggersmeetup), [Art Club](https://www.meetup.com/London-Art-Club-Deep-Work/) and [Podcast Club](https://www.meetup.com/London-Podcasting-Community/) and [Creator Write Club](https://www.meetup.com/London-Write-Club/), as well as other MeetUps, since 2009.

During COVID and lockdown, we lost our way with all these meet-ups and never got it back.

After trying many ways to kick start the whole thing, we found our true passion is getting people together to meet, connect and share their work.

Something we never worked out was how to pay people for running [Art Club](https://www.meetup.com/London-Art-Club-Deep-Work/) and [Podcast Club](https://www.meetup.com/London-Podcasting-Community/) \- it is essential as creators and artists to earn a living and build up your sense of self\-worth\.

"It's great exposure for your work" is a poor offer to build your creative career.

# Vision and next action:

Over the next few weeks, we'll invite you to join [Creator Write Club](https://www.meetup.com/London-Write-Club/) and close all our other groups.

The vision is to continue building this meet-up group into a place where every day in London, there is a chance to get together, talk about your work and, most importantly, get your creative jobs done.

You'll be able to meet daily at [Creator Write ](https://www.meetup.com/London-Write-Club/)Clubs across London AND the Friday Creator Clubs.

**🎥 [Watch this clip on Instagram from previous Creator Clubs.](https://www.instagram.com/reel/CgO8gg3oomj/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link) 🎥**

# Can't make this event?

## RSVP for the following in-person [Creator Write Club](https://www.meetup.com/London-Write-Club/)

## -> [Town Square Islington](https://www.townsqislington.co.uk) Tuesdays

## -> [Creative Works E17](https://www.creativeworks.space) Wednesdays

## -> [Impact Brixton](https://impactbrixton.com) Fridays

title: Write Club Old Street (Tuesday)
description:
**Welcome to Creators Write Club!**
Everybody Writes!

We've been meeting weekly (apart from 2020/21 COVID lockdowns) since 2014.

**What is Creators Write Club?**
Write Club is where you can write **anything** from a book chapter to a work email to a song or comedy script.

People write academic papers, podcast show notes, pitches, film documentaries, social media posts and project plans.

**Who comes to Creators Write Club?**
Every week authors, freelancers, artists, academics, comedians, gamers, marketers, bloggers, developers, podcasters, event managers, musicians, poets, lawyers and sailors gather around a table with one goal - to work on their writing for two hours.

**Join us from 10 am to 12 pm.**
This group is the Wednesday Group, and we are hosted at the [Town Square Islington](https://www.townsqislington.co.uk/) coworking space by the Old Street Roundabout.

**[Town Square](https://www.townsqislington.co.uk/) part of White Collar Factory is a 1-minute walk from Old Street tube on the Northern Line.**

Barbican and Liverpool Street stations are about fifteen minutes walk.

**How does Creators Write Club work?**
Come and be ready to share what you intend to work on in the session.

We'll all write for around two hours and check-in again at the end, so share our progress.

**That sounds scary?!**
We make extra effort to make sure everyone feels welcome and can do their work.
You only need to share what you are comfortable with sharing.

This group has always been relaxed, open and supportive.

**Food and Drink?**
There is tea, filter coffee, wifi and water here, and feel free to bring some cakes, fruit or brain food to share!

Nearby is O-zone Coffee, The Daily Grind and Pret.

We've been meeting weekly (apart from 2020/21 COVID lockdowns) since 2014.

**What is Creators Write Club?**
Write Club is where you can write **anything** from a book chapter to a work email to a song or comedy script.

People write academic papers, podcast show notes, pitches, film documentaries, social media posts and project plans.

**Who comes to Creators Write Club?**
Every week authors, freelancers, artists, academics, comedians, gamers, marketers, bloggers, developers, podcasters, event managers, musicians, poets, lawyers and sailors gather around a table with one goal - to work on their writing for two hours.

**Join us from 10 am to 12 pm.**
This group is the Wednesday Group, and we are hosted at the [Town Square Islington](https://www.townsqislington.co.uk/) coworking space by the Old Street Roundabout.

**[Town Square](https://www.townsqislington.co.uk/) part of White Collar Factory is a 1-minute walk from Old Street tube on the Northern Line.**

Barbican and Liverpool Street stations are about fifteen minutes walk.

**How does Creators Write Club work?**
Come and be ready to share what you intend to work on in the session.

We'll all write for around two hours and check-in again at the end, so share our progress.

**That sounds scary?!**
We make extra effort to make sure everyone feels welcome and can do their work.
You only need to share what you are comfortable with sharing.

This group has always been relaxed, open and supportive.

**Food and Drink?**
There is tea, filter coffee, wifi and water here, and feel free to bring some cakes, fruit or brain food to share!

Nearby is O-zone Coffee, The Daily Grind and Pret.

Every week authors, freelancers, artists, academics, comedians, gamers, marketers, bloggers, developers, podcasters, event managers, musicians, poets, lawyers and sailors gather around a table with one goal - to work on their writing for two hours.

**Join us from 10 am to 12 pm.**
This group is the Wednesday Group, and we are hosted at the [Town Square Islington](https://www.townsqislington.co.uk/) coworking space by the Old Street Roundabout.

**[Town Square](https://www.townsqislington.co.uk/) part of White Collar Factory is a 1-minute walk from Old Street tube on the Northern Line.**

Barbican and Liverpool Street stations are about fifteen minutes walk.

**How does Creators Write Club work?**
Come and be ready to share what you intend to work on in the session.

We'll all write for around two hours and check-in again at the end, so share our progress.

**That sounds scary?!**
We make extra effort to make sure everyone feels welcome and can do their work.
You only need to share what you are comfortable with sharing.

This group has always been relaxed, open and supportive.

**Food and Drink?**
There is tea, filter coffee, wifi and water here, and feel free to bring some cakes, fruit or brain food to share!

Nearby is O-zone Coffee, The Daily Grind and Pret.

title: Writing @ the Laundrette
description:
We will be running a social writing event in what used to be our family-run laundrette. Now a coffee house we love believes in creativity. I, as the owner, am writing a novel and will be joining the writing sessions along with attendees.

This is a writing workshop and created to encourage writers of all levels. I have been running similar sessions for 2 years, the last year they have been online but now with the opening up of businesses, I would like to resume these sessions.

Writing workshops have been great opportunities for writers to spend concentrated time on the pieces. We do not run feedback sessions but these groups create the opportunity for writers to share their work with others in a social environment. It can take away the loneliness out of writing and creates a fantastic opportunity to meet other writers. Not to mention the contagious effects of writing in silence alongside others.

The structure of the evening will consist of a short greeting, followed by writing in silence. At the end of the 2 hours, we will book a pub nearby and spend some time together sharing our own writing experience.

I look forward to meeting all who want to come along.

This used to be my favourite writing spot, while mum would wash her clothes I would sit on the thin yellow benches that matched the walls.

Now it is my favourite writing spot.

This is a writing workshop and created to encourage writers of all levels. I have been running similar sessions for 2 years, the last year they have been online but now with the opening up of businesses, I would like to resume these sessions.

Writing workshops have been great opportunities for writers to spend concentrated time on the pieces. We do not run feedback sessions but these groups create the opportunity for writers to share their work with others in a social environment. It can take away the loneliness out of writing and creates a fantastic opportunity to meet other writers. Not to mention the contagious effects of writing in silence alongside others.

The structure of the evening will consist of a short greeting, followed by writing in silence. At the end of the 2 hours, we will book a pub nearby and spend some time together sharing our own writing experience.

I look forward to meeting all who want to come along.

title: Writing @ the Laundrette
description:
We will be running a writing event in what used to be our family-run laundrette. Now a coffee house we love believes in creativity.

\*\*As a side note - I will be away till April and during this period I have asked the regular members to fill in as hosts. Come along and enjoy\*\*

These sessions are self-run. This space is reserved for writers. With or without the event manager the space is filled with other writers, all writing.

Once you book it, just turn up and write!

These sessions are set up to create accountability and as writing is such a solo endeavour it is there to meet others with similar goals.

This used to be my favourite reading spot, while mum would wash her clothes I would sit on the thin yellow benches that matched the walls and read. Now I write here.

This writing workshop is created to encourage writers of all levels. I have been running similar sessions for 3 years. Writing workshops have been great opportunities for writers to spend concentrated time on the pieces. We do not run feedback sessions but these groups create the opportunity for writers to share their work with others in a social environment. It can take away the loneliness out of writing and create a fantastic opportunity to meet other writers. Not to mention the contagious effects of writing in silence alongside others.

The structure of the session will consist of a short greeting, followed by writing in silence. At the end of the 2 hours, writers it and socialise.

I look forward to meeting all who want to come along, if at times I am not there talk to the other writers. This is an opportunity for you to write, i hope you enjoy and get lots of writing done.

Sinem

description:
We will be running a social writing event in what used to be our family-run laundrette. Now a coffee house we love believes in creativity. I, as the owner, am writing a novel and will be joining the writing sessions along with attendees.

This is a writing workshop and created to encourage writers of all levels. I have been running similar sessions for 2 years, the last year they have been online but now with the opening up of businesses, I would like to resume these sessions.

Writing workshops have been great opportunities for writers to spend concentrated time on the pieces. We do not run feedback sessions but these groups create the opportunity for writers to share their work with others in a social environment. It can take away the loneliness out of writing and creates a fantastic opportunity to meet other writers. Not to mention the contagious effects of writing in silence alongside others.

The structure of the evening will consist of a short greeting, followed by writing in silence. At the end of the 2 hours, we will book a pub nearby and spend some time together sharing our own writing experience.

I look forward to meeting all who want to come along.

title: Writing @ the Laundrette
description:
We will be running a writing event in what used to be our family-run laundrette. Now a coffee house we love believes in creativity.

\*\*As a side note - I will be away till April and during this period I have asked the regular members to fill in as hosts. Come along and enjoy\*\*

These sessions are self-run. This space is reserved for writers. With or without the event manager the space is filled with other writers, all writing.

Once you book it, just turn up and write!

These sessions are set up to create accountability and as writing is such a solo endeavour it is there to meet others with similar goals.

This used to be my favourite reading spot, while mum would wash her clothes I would sit on the thin yellow benches that matched the walls and read. Now I write here.

This writing workshop is created to encourage writers of all levels. I have been running similar sessions for 3 years. I look forward to meeting all who want to come along, if at times I am not there talk to the other writers. This is an opportunity for you to write, i hope you enjoy and get lots of writing done.

Sinem

\*\*As a side note - I will be away till April and during this period I have asked the regular members to fill in as hosts. Come along and enjoy\*\*

These sessions are self-run. This space is reserved for writers. With or without the event manager the space is filled with other writers, all writing.

Once you book it, just turn up and write!

These sessions are set up to create accountability and as writing is such a solo endeavour it is there to meet others with similar goals.

This used to be my favourite reading spot, while mum would wash her clothes I would sit on the thin yellow benches that matched the walls and read. Now I write here.

This writing workshop is created to encourage writers of all levels. I have been running similar sessions for 3 years. Writing workshops have been great opportunities for writers to spend concentrated time on the pieces. We do not run feedback sessions but these groups create the opportunity for writers to share their work with others in a social environment. It can take away the loneliness out of writing and create a fantastic opportunity to meet other writers. Not to mention the contagious effects of writing in silence alongside others.

The structure of the session will consist of a short greeting, followed by writing in silence. At the end of the 2 hours, writers it and socialise.

I look forward to meeting all who want to come along, if at times I am not there talk to the other writers. This is an opportunity for you to write, i hope you enjoy and get lots of writing done.

Sinem

We do not run feedback sessions but these groups create the opportunity for writers to share their work with others in a social environment. It can take away the loneliness out of writing and creates a fantastic opportunity to meet other writers. Not to mention the contagious effects of writing in silence alongside others.

The structure of the evening will consist of a short greeting, followed by writing in silence. At the end of the 2 hours, we will book a pub nearby and spend some time together sharing our own writing experience.

I look forward to meeting all who want to come along.

title: Script Bootcamp Intro (Free)
description:
This is a free introductory class which prepares students for the intensive 8-week script bootcamp. In this introductory class on July 25, professional repped screenwriter Conor Kyle will teach you the process of taking an idea and developing it into a story, outline and complete feature screenplay first draft.

Bring up to 3 loglines / brand new script ideas! Conor is requesting that students use newer, fresher ideas, and stay away from the magnum opuses you've been working on or thinking about for years. The intention behind this camp is not for you to write a perfect script, but instead to teach you the organization skills, discipline, and craft techniques that will set you on the path to becoming a professional screenwriter.

This event will take place on the Script Camp Discord server: https://discord.gg/mUtQKbtsgb

8-Week Script Bootcamp Course Description:
In this eight-week live bootcamp, you’ll go from a blank page to the first draft of a complete feature screenplay. You’ll attend one three-hour class session each week in which we’ll walk through the entire process of conceiving, outlining, and writing an 80 to 120-page script. Conor will make plenty of time to take questions from students, as well as to review your work and offer feedback. This is an intensive crash-course for all skill levels, intended to keep students motivated and on track as they make their story come to life.

Week 1: Why this story?
Now that you've narrowed down your high-concept idea, we will ask the simple questions: why this story? Why now? What is both timely and universal in your idea? We will begin to chisel away at the central dramatic question of your script, and design a plan to explore this theme from all angles. You'll refine and polish your story's premise, and begin the process of outlining.

Week 2: Outlining I – Broad Strokes
Now that you’ve selected your feature idea, we’ll look at the key building blocks of your story. Chiefly: how to structure and place key scenes, and begin to establish connective tissue between them.

Week 3: Outlining II – Scene Cards
Time to organize your ideas into a much more detailed outline. These “scene cards” will each feature a key moment of your story, and you’ll organize your brainstormed sketches into a cohesive, page-by-page plan for your upcoming feature.

Week 4: Beginnings
It’s time to get going on your feature! This class will feature a both a FAQ / troubleshooting session (where we address and fill holes in your outlines before you begin) and a lecture on first acts: everything from opening image to the act break. From this class on, you’ll have to write a few pages a day to keep up with the benchmarks and get optimal feedback on your script.

Week 5: Transitions
You’ve finished the first 20-30 pages of your script, so this class focuses on your first act break. How do we diagnose whether we’ve done everything we need to do in act one? We’ll heavily emphasize a propulsive boost into the “fun and games” of your script’s second act, balancing B-stories, and more.

Week 6: Act 2 A
This class follows us into the deep dark woods of your script: the second act. We’ll go over the creation of sequences and setpieces, and review how to find the fun in your premise and mine its full potential.

Week 7: Act 2 B
Many newer writers begin to falter or repeat themselves in this section of a script, so we’ll focus on keeping up the energy and narrative push, as well as beginning to answer questions and pay off setups from earlier in the script. Danger and tension must ramp up significantly in this section, and we’ll make sure our scripts are doing just that.

Week 8: Act 3
In our eighth and final week, we will work through the difficult final act of your script. How do we conclude subplots? How can we leave the reader feeling satisfied with the ideal “unexpected yet inevitable” conclusion?

title: Structure & Pacing
description:
This two-hour live and interactive class will delve deeply into feature film structure and pacing. You’ll break open some famous movie stories, identify their primary beats, and understand how your stories can both adhere to or break these conventions. You'll also learn the steps to build and maintain narrative momentum, examining the timing, rhythm, and structural role of key scenes.

This is class is free and everyone is welcome. Be sure to RSVP early to reserve your spot.

How to enroll in the FREE Screenwriting Structure class:
• Hit the RSVP button
• Then drop by our discord server and meet Conor and your fellow students: https://discord.gg/mUtQKbtsgb

About the Instructor:
Conor Kyle has written for Creepshow (2019) and placed twice in the Nicholl Fellowship with his scripts “Peter and the Wolves” (quarterfinals, also Launchpad top 10) and The Tube (semifinals). His screenplays have also been featured on the annual Hit List, Young & Hungry List, Spec Book, and on Tracking Board’s “Best Writers of the Year” booklet. He writes everything from stage musicals to Westerns to horror movies, and has taught screenwriting in Summer camps and online courses since 2018.

If you don't have discord, you can download it here: https://discord.com/download

title: Sunday Script Bootcamp: Week 1

Danger and tension must ramp up significantly in this section, and we’ll make sure our scripts are doing just that.

Week 8: Act 3
In our eighth and final week, we will work through the difficult final act of your script. How do we conclude subplots? How can we leave the reader feeling satisfied with the ideal “unexpected yet inevitable” conclusion?

title: Sunday Script Bootcamp: Week 2
description:
Sunday Script Bootcamp is an intensive 8-week course that meets weekly on Sundays. Pro screenwriter Conor Kyle walks you through the process of conceiving, outlining and writing a complete 80-120 page first draft, with personal feedback on your loglines, outlines and script pages.

Week 2: Outlining I – Broad Strokes
Now that you’ve selected your feature idea, we’ll look at the key building blocks of your story. Chiefly: how to structure and place key scenes, and begin to establish connective tissue between them.

This event will take place on discord: https://discord.gg/mUtQKbtsgb

How to enroll in the Sunday Script Bootcamp:
• You can either purchase this course "a la carte" (enter coupon code MEETUP50 when you check out for $50 off): https://scriptcamp.net/product/script-bootcamp-sunday/
• Or start your free trial Unlimited Script Camp membership (includes access to all Saturday bootcamps, Sunday bootcamps, regular feedback on your ideas, outlines and pages from pro screenwriter Conor Kyle, plus all the supplemental weekday classes, over 30 hours of live classes per month): https://scriptcamp.net/membership/
• Then drop by our discord server and meet Conor and your fellow students: https://discord.gg/mUtQKbtsgb

About the Instructor:
Conor Kyle has written for Shudder's Creepshow (2019) and placed twice in the Nicholl Fellowship with his scripts “Peter and the Wolves” (quarterfinals, also Launchpad top 10) and The Tube (semifinals). His screenplays have also been featured on the annual Hit List, Young & Hungry List, Spec Book, and on Tracking Board’s “Best Writers of the Year” booklet. He writes everything from stage musicals to Westerns to horror movies.

Complete schedule:
Week 1: Why this story?
Now that you've narrowed down your high-concept idea, we will ask the simple questions: why this story? Why now? What is both timely and universal in your idea? We will begin to chisel away at the central dramatic question of your script, and design a plan to explore this theme from all angles. You'll refine and polish your story's premise, and begin the process of outlining.

Week 3: Outlining II – Scene Cards
Time to organize your ideas into a much more detailed outline. These “scene cards” will each feature a key moment of your story, and you’ll organize your brainstormed sketches into a cohesive, page-by-page plan for your upcoming feature.

Week 4: Beginnings
It’s time to get going on your feature! This class will feature a both a FAQ / troubleshooting session (where we address and fill holes in your outlines before you begin) and a lecture on first acts: everything from opening image to the act break. From this class on, you’ll have to write a few pages a day to keep up with the benchmarks and get optimal feedback on your script.

Week 5: Transitions
You’ve finished the first 20-30 pages of your script, so this class focuses on your first act break. How do we diagnose whether we’ve done everything we need to do in act one? We’ll heavily emphasize a propulsive boost into the “fun and games” of your script’s second act, balancing B-stories, and more.

Week 6: Act 2 A
This class follows us into the deep dark woods of your script: the second act. We’ll go over the creation of sequences and setpieces, and review how to find the fun in your premise and mine its full potential.

Week 7: Act 2 B
Many newer writers begin to falter or repeat themselves in this section of a script, so we’ll focus on keeping up the energy and narrative push, as well as beginning to answer questions and pay off setups from earlier in the script. Danger and tension must ramp up significantly in this section, and we’ll make sure our scripts are doing just that.

Week 8: Act 3
In our eighth and final week, we will work through the difficult final act of your script. How do we conclude subplots? How can we leave the reader feeling satisfied with the ideal “unexpected yet inevitable” conclusion?

title: Screenwriting Class: Endings
description:
How does it all end? In this two-hour live and interactive class, we'll look at examples of great endings from different genres, and why they work. You'll peel apart the exact mechanics of finales and climaxes, and connect all the threads that your story has left hanging. The ending in your outline - by this point - might not be the best ending for your story anymore, and we will make sure that your script has a finish line that is worth running toward.

Please note this class requires $9/month basic script camp membership

title: Screenwriting Class: Writing Dialogue
description:
Like a lot of storytelling, writing dialogue is the act of excision, and cutting right to the interesting parts. In this two hour live and interactive class, we will explore what makes movie dialogue unique and special and how to reveal character through dialogue. We will also dive into subtext, developing a distinct voice for each character and how to diagnose and rewrite dialogue.
